org.apache.flex.compiler.internal.mxml

Class MXMLUnitData

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.flex.compiler.common.SourceLocation
      • org.apache.flex.compiler.internal.mxml.MXMLUnitData
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ISourceLocation, IMXMLUnitData
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    MXMLInstructionData, MXMLTagData, MXMLTextData

    public abstract class MXMLUnitData
extends SourceLocation
implements IMXMLUnitData
    Encapsulation of an MXML unit: an open/close/empty tag, a chunk of text (perhaps whitespace, CDATA, or a comment), or a processing instruction.

    An MXMLData object stores a linear list of MXML units, but it is possible to walk them in a hierarchical way.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected int index
      This position of this unit in the linear list of units owned by the MXMLData.

      int getContentStart()
      Returns the first character of the actual content of the unit For most units this is the same as getStart(), but for things like tags which have "junk punctuation" around them, SourceLocation.getAbsoluteStart() will return the junk punctuation, whereas getContentStart will get the content inside the punctuation.

    • Method Detail

      • getContentStart

        public int getContentStart()
        Description copied from interface: IMXMLUnitData
        Returns the first character of the actual content of the unit For most units this is the same as getStart(), but for things like tags which have "junk punctuation" around them, SourceLocation.getAbsoluteStart() will return the junk punctuation, whereas getContentStart will get the content inside the punctuation.
        Specified by:
        getContentStart in interface IMXMLUnitData

      • getContentEnd

        public int getContentEnd()
        Description copied from interface: IMXMLUnitData
        Returns the offset after the last character of actual content. See IMXMLUnitData.getContentStart() for more.
        Specified by:
        getContentEnd in interface IMXMLUnitData

      • getContainingTag

        public final IMXMLTagData getContainingTag(int offset)
        Description copied from interface: IMXMLUnitData
        Get the nearest containing tag. Moving backwards through the list of tokens for this MXML file, this is the first open tag that you find for which you haven't found a corresponding close.
        Specified by:
        getContainingTag in interface IMXMLUnitData
        Returns:
        nearest containing open tag (or null, if no such open tag exists)
